languageTools.program.agent.validation.agentfile

Class RuleValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • languageTools.program.agent.validation.Validator<Rule>
      • languageTools.program.agent.validation.agentfile.RuleValidator

  • public class RuleValidator
extends Validator<Rule>
    Validator for a Rule.
    Checks for the following errors:
    • The occurrence of actions without specifications in the body of the rule.
    • The occurrence of a nested action combo, null action, or focus action in the body of the rule.
    • The occurrence of unbound variables in (postconditions of) actions in the body of the rule. This includes anonymous variables.
    • The occurrence of anonymous variables in a ListallDoRule.
    • The use of undefined macros, or related isues.
    Checks for the following warning:
    • The occurrence of more than one exit-module action in the body of the rule.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink, K.Hindriks

    • Method Detail

      • doValidate

        protected void doValidate(Rule subject)
        Checks if a Rule contains only actions with variables that are bound in its condition. The error messages also contain the names of the free variables. Also resolves references to macro's in the rule's condition.
        Specified by:
        doValidate in class Validator<Rule>
        Parameters:
        subject - The rule to validate.

      • countOfExitModuleActions

        protected static int countOfExitModuleActions(Rule rule)
        Helper method used by RuleValidator and ModuleValidator for checking that exit-module action is used at most once in a rule and never in a top-level module.
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to check.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences of the exit-module action in the ActionCombo of this Rule.
